site.description: Stand together against the novel coronavirus outbreak in Hong Kong. We provide hygiene tips, high-risk area, A&E waiting time, lists of blacklisted pharmacies, and more.
site.keywords: COVID-19, coronavirus, wuhan, accident & emergency, a&e, A&E, mask, pharmacy, 2019-nCoV, ncov
dodgy_shops.source_from: The information is according to various sources
dodgy_shops.stop_update: Due to the steady supply of hygiene products, we have stopped updating this page. Information below is for reference only.
dodgy_shops.disclaimer: The following information on dubious pharmacies is an amalgamation of netizen reports. Note that due to the increased demand for medical supplies worldwide, the cost of medical supplies has gone up as well; pharmacies that simply sell legitimate medical supplies at higher prices are not necessarily dubious. We recommend paying more attention to stores that sell defective products (e.g. used or low-quality masks, diluted rubbing alcohol, etc.) over stores that simply price-gouge. If you have any further issues, please consider contacting the Hong Kong Consumer Council.

waiting_time.title: A&E Wait Time
waiting_time.content: When patients arrive at the A&E Department, they will be assessed by an experienced and specially trained triage nurse according to the severity and nature of their medical conditions, and priority will be given to critical, emergency and urgent cases. The following data is collated from the waiting time of other patients in the past few hours. This is for reference only, and does not necessarily represent the current estimated waiting time.

about_us.title: Who are we?
about_us.who_are_we_1: With the sudden outbreak of COVID-2019 (novel coronavirus), Hong Kong's first case of the disease was confirmed on 23 January 2020. In view of the disease becoming increasingly threatening, the vote4hk team started collecting information both from internet and government sources on 26 January. Two days later, we uploaded this website, "COVID-19 in HK", where we aim to integrate information about high-risk areas, patientsâ€™ conditions, information about dubious stores and health tips.
about_us.who_are_we_2: Back in 2019, we developed vote4.hk, a website where we aggregated background information of district council constituencies, candidates running in the election, data on previous elections, election results, and more.
about_us.who_are_we_3: The operation of this site depends on the restless hard work of our volunteers, who verify and update the contents whenever necessary. The developers also endeavour to add new functions to the website whenever possible. Also, we owe our gratitude to g0vhk and Station for Open Cultures, who fully supported this website and contributed valuable suggestions to our team.
about_us.who_are_we_4: We would also like to thank the 4 university students who set up the website "sosick.org" during the 2003 SARS outbreak, where they maintained a list of SARS hotspots and gathered news about the outbreak. Their efforts helped HKers overcome SARS, and inspired us to follow in their footsteps 17 years later.
about_us.g0vhk_1: The vote4.hk team was formed at one of the g0vhk hackathons last year. g0vhk advocates for civic engagement, the disclosure of data and the right to access information through the use of technology.
about_us.sooc_1: Station for Open Cultures advocates for openness, progressiveness, plurality, and egalitarianism. They organise various hackathons, technological talks, workshops, among other events. Vote4.hk often conducts meetings and collaborative operations at venues provided by Station for Open Cultures.
about_us.donation: Your donation will help g0vhk and Station for Open Cultures in organising more activities to promote an open culture and civil technology. It will also become the fund for them to start new projects, part of your donation will be used to subsidise their costs in providing cloud services.
about_us.open_source: We derive resources from our society to contribute back to it. The source code of this site and information are all open for use.
about_us.citation: If you wish to cite anything from this site, please credit us as 'covid19.vote4.hk - COVID-19 in HK'.
about_us.donate_sooc: Donate to Station of Open Cultures
about_us.sponsor_html: Thanks to Kintohub for the sponsorship on our server cost.
